mt2gf package¶

Submodules¶

mt2gf.gform module¶

mt2gf.gform.download_csv(csv_path, fileId, service, verbose=False)¶

Download the spreadsheet result of a form as a csv file

Parameters

  • csv_path (str) – path where to store a local .csv version of the spreadsheet

  • fileId (str) – drive id of the spreadsheet

  • service (googleapiclient.discovery.Resource]) – as returned by get_drive_service

mt2gf.gform.download_drive_txt(gform_map_path, gform_map_id, service)¶

Download the gform_map file to the provided path

Parameters

  • gform_map_path (str) – path where to store a local version of the gform_map

  • gform_map_id (str) – gdrive id of the gform_map

  • service (gdrive service) – as returned by get_drive_service

mt2gf.gform.download_multi_csv(gform_map, result_dir, service)¶

Iterate over the forms present in the gform_map and sequentially calls download_csv on, downloading their respective most recent version

Parameters

  • gform_map (dict) – dictionary mapping to each form index the url to the corresponding

  • form ('url' key) –

  • key) (('driveid') –

  • result_dir (str) – directory where to download the results.

  • service (googleapiclient.discovery.Resource]) – as returned by get_drive_service

mt2gf.gform.get_batch_gform_map(service, file_id, gform_map_path, form_indexes)¶

Used in case of batched dataset gathering. Returns the subpart of gform_map specific to the form_indexes passed in parameter

Parameters

  • service (googleapiclient.discovery.Resource) – as returned by get_drive_service

  • gform_map_id (str) – drive_id of the gform_map file. This file must respect the following structure:

  • index> (<form) –

  • to form> (<url) –

  • to form spreadsheet> (<url) –

  • gform_map_path (str) – path where to store a local version of the gform_map.txt file

  • form_indexes (list of int) – indexes of the forms for the current batch

mt2gf.gform.get_drive_service(creds_dir)¶

Return the drive service for files downloading. Inspired from https://developers.google.com/people/quickstart/python

Parameters

  • creds_dir (pathlib.Path) – path to directory containing the credentials.json.

  • to obtain such a file are available here https (Instructions) – //developers.google.com/people/quickstart/python/

Returns

service object to Google Drive

Return type

[googleapiclient.discovery.Resource]

mt2gf.gform.get_gform_map(service, gform_map_id, gform_map_path)¶

Return the gform_map,i.e. a dictionary mapping to each form index the url to the corresponding form (‘url’ key) and the drive id pointing to the spreadsheet containing the results of this form (‘driveid’ key).

Parameters

  • service (googleapiclient.discovery.Resource) – as returned by get_drive_service

  • gform_map_id (str) – drive_id of the gform_map file. This file must respect the following structure:

  • index> (<form) –

  • to form> (<url) –

  • to form spreadsheet> (<url) –

  • gform_map_path (str) – path where to store a local version of the gform_map.txt file

Returns

dictionary mapping to each form index the url to the corresponding form (‘url’ key) and the drive id pointing to the spreadsheet containing the results of this form (‘driveid’ key).

Return type

[dict]

mt2gf.mturk module¶

Script to automate the creation and handling of MTurk task: it assumes you have a gform_map.txt file pointing to Google forms as describe in the README.

class mt2gf.mturk.MTurkParam(aws_key_path, hit_layout, MaxAssignments, LifetimeInDays, AutoApprovalDelayInDays, AssignmentDurationInSeconds, QualificationRequirements, Reward, HITTitle, Keywords, Description, production=False)¶

Bases: object

Parameter object for the Turker instances: all parameters in ThisFormat end up in boto3 call, in contrast to this_format, used for other tasks.

class mt2gf.mturk.Turker(meta_dir, param, gservice, gform_map, formresdir, conf_code_generator=None, frauder_callbacks=[], check_conf_code=False, check_code_frauders=False)¶

Bases: object

Class to perform

approve_all_assignments(hit_id)¶

Approve all assignments corresponding to the provided HIT id, regardless of their validity (No quality check or callbacks performed) If you wish to perform quality_check, cf approve_correct_assignments

Parameters

correct_hits (Bool) – whether to correct correct hits exclusively

approve_all_hits()¶

Approve all assignments of all HITs regardless of their validity (No quality check or callbacks performed) If you wish to perform quality_check, cf approve_correct_assignments

approve_correct_assignments(hit_id, callbacks=None, check_code_frauders=None, dry_run=False)¶

Approve assignments in Reviewable state corresponding to the provided HIT id.

Parameters

  • hit_id (str) – MTurk HIT id

  • callbacks (list of func) – If value is set, overrides self.frauder_callbacks.

  • of functions detecting frauders (List) –

  • is WorkerIDs that need to be rejected (that) –

  • a given HIT. Each such function takes as single argument a pd.DataFrame corresponding to this HIT as returned by mt2gf.Turker.get_results (for) –

  • is ((that) –

  • pd.DataFrame whose columns are equal to the google forms questions fields) and returns a set of string consisting (a) –

  • the Worker IDs whose Assignment must be rejected for the given HIT. (of) –

  • check_code_frauders (Bool) – If value is set, overrides self.check_code_frauders. When set to True, will reject any WorkerId present

  • an MTurk HIt but absent of the Google form. This makes sure that no HIT will be validated without data in the Google Form. (in) –

  • NB – Worker entering a malformed ID are rejected as well

  • dry_run (Bool) – if set to True, no HIT will be effectively validated or rejected: the output

approve_correct_hits(dry_run=False)¶

Approve all the HITs that don’t violate any of the callback functions, reject the others.

Parameters

  • dry_run (Bool) – if set to True, no HIT will be effectively validated or rejected: the output

  • the same for pre-checking the effect of a wet run. (remains) –

create_forms_hits()¶

Generate and publish the HITs corresponding to the forms whose index are present in Turker.gform_map

delete_all_hits()¶

Deletes all HITs having been been reviewed

delete_hit(hit_id)¶

Delete the hit hit_id from the Mturk platform. Fails in case the hit is not reviewed.

Parameters

hit_id (str) – Mturk HIT id

get_results(id)¶

Download and return the most recent version of the Google Forms results corresponding to id (HITid or Google form index) as a pd.Dataframe ()

Parameters

id (int or str) – if int, must correspond to the index of the Google form. If string, must correspond to a valid HIT id

Returns

results: data filled by the MTurk Workers

Return type

[pd.DataFrame]

Returns

Concatenation of the dataframe returned by list_assignments for all HITs.

Return type

Parameters

Returns

Columns WorkerId,HITId,FormId,ConfCode,AcceptTime,SubmitTime,TrueConfCode,Status

Return type

list_hits()¶

Published HITs informations: HITId,Status,Completed,Percent_completed Completed designates the number of completed forms for the given HIT. Once Percent_completed reaches 100, the HIT status becomes “Assignable”

Returns

Dataframe with HITId,Status,Completed,Percent_completed columns

Return type

[pd.DataFrame]

list_reviewable_hits()¶

List the HITs in a reviwable state

save_worker_infos(directory=None)¶

Save the workers metadata (completion time etc)

Parameters

  • directory (str) – directory in which the worker infos will be saved. Defaults

  • the formresdir directory. (to) –

stop_all_hits()¶

Call Turker.stop_hit for every hit.

stop_hit(hit_id)¶

Update the expiration date of the hit at a past date. This allows the assignable hits to go to “Reviewable” state as soon as possible (lets the workers already working finish their task first)

mt2gf.mturk.create_mturk_client(aws_access_key_id, aws_secret_access_key, production=False)¶

Return an MTURK client. Inspired from https://blog.mturk.com/tutorial-mturk-using-python-in-jupyter-notebook-17ba0745a97f

Parameters

  • aws_access_key_id (str) – aws key

  • aws_secret_access_key (str) – secret aws key

  • production (Bool) – sandbox if set to false

Returns

low level boto3 object allowing for HITs manipulation

Return type

client (boto3.client)

mt2gf.preprocess module¶

Preprocessing functions before mturk data gathering

mt2gf.preprocess.batchnumber2formidxes(batch_number, batch_size)¶

Convert a batch number to its respective form indexes

Parameters

  • batch_number (int) – index of the batch

  • batch_size (int) – size of the batch

mt2gf.preprocess.check_is_complete(batch_path, MaxAssignments, batch_size)¶

check that the batch present at batch_path follows some structure: i.e. has batch_size files and each file has at least MaxAssignments rows.

Parameters

  • batch_path (str) – path where to store the results of the batch

  • MaxAssignments (int) – total number of worker answer expected per form

  • batch_size (int) – number of forms to get ansewred per batch

mt2gf.preprocess.check_previous_batches(recent_batch_number, parent_dir, MaxAssignments, batch_size)¶

Check the number of files and their size in all previous batches up to current batch

Parameters

  • recent_bach_number (int) – most recent batch (not included)

  • parent_dir (pathlib.Path) – parent directory in containing the batches

  • MaxAssignments (int) – total number of worker answer expected per form

  • batch_size (int) – number of forms to get ansewred per batch

mt2gf.preprocess.create_batch_directories(directory, n_dirs)¶

create the directories to receive the results from the batches

Parameters

  • directory (pathlib.Path) – directory in which create the batches directories

  • n_dirs (int) – number of directories to create

mt2gf.watcher module¶

class mt2gf.watcher.Watcher(form_results_dir, gform_map, drive_service, aws_key_path, qualification_type_name='', qualification_description='', qualification_type_id=None, max_forms_per_worker=2, production=False)¶

Bases: object

Class to monitor the workers who answer more than max_forms_per_worker forms in the pool. Once a worker reaches this limit, the watcher class who runs a subprocess tag the worker by granting him/her with an MTurk qualification that will prevent him/her to find any other form associated with the current pool.

This allows to guarantee a certain MTurk workers diversity in the pool answerers.

get_qualif_requirement()¶

Return the qualification requirement associated with the current watcher.

Returns

Qualification Requirement as in the boto3 nomenclature

Return type

[dict]

get_tagged_workers()¶

Return the set of Workerid that are already tagged

Returns

tagged workers ids

Return type

[set of str]

get_workers2tag()¶

Return the set of workerid that need to get tagged

Returns

set of Worker Id that need to be tagged in order not to find any more forms from the pool in their MTurk searche

Return type

[set of str]

monitor(sleep_time=10)¶

Function to run in detached thread: checks periodically for new workers to tag Downloads at each iteration the most recent version of the results for the current batch’s forms.

Parameters

sleep_time (int) – time to sleep at each iteration

start_monitor()¶

Detaches a thread executing the Watcher.monitor function if no thread is already running.

stop_monitor()¶

Stop the thread executing the Watcher.monitor function if such a thread is running.

untag_all_workers()¶

Untag all workers tagged with the qualification type associated with the Watcher

class mt2gf.widgets.ControlPanel(turk, watcher=None)¶

Bases: object

Ipywidgets panel allowing high-level control of the HITs creation,confirmation validation and deletion along with monitoring of number of HITs per worker
